name: Hotel Montreal Espace Confort

reviews.text: We were really impressed with the Montreal Espace Confort hotel. The rooms are modern and have good facilities including kitchenette, the staff are very friendly and the location perfect for tourists with many restaurants and bars within a few minutes walk. The continental breakfast included in the price was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other visitors to Montreal.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Espace from June 29 to July 5, 2006 in order to enjoy the jazz fest. We were very happy with this hotel based on the location, nice rooms and cheap rates. It isn't all perfect though. I stayed in room 201 and it is very noisy with the stairwell right behind the bed. I would suggest that any room ending in 01 will be near the stairs and should be avoided unless you want to wear earplugs while you sleep (yuck). Also, the shower in my room didn't have too much pressure, however, this was not the case in two of the other rooms my friends stayed in which had a good deal of pressure (go figure). All in all, it was a nice clean hotel with comfortable rooms that aren't shoddy at all. The rate was fantastic as well. The wi-fi for the internet isn't so great. We actually ended up using the wi-fi from the neighbouring hotel.
reviews.title: A Nice Option in the Latin Quarter

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel and would definately stay there again, just not in room 101, 201, 301, or 401.
reviews.title: Best value for money in Montreal

reviews.text: I really enjoyed this little hotel, in an interesting street to say the least, lots of cafes and colourful characters. The hotel is modern but boutique, the room was very comfortable. It had plenty of space, a refrigerator, microwave and TV, all you could want in a short stay. The bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean. The room was back off the street and quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful and if you need breakfast early you can help yourself as it is laid out very early in the morning. It is about a 20 minute easy walk to the city centre or 10 minute walk to the nearest metro stop.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.text: I am not prissy, but I'm also not 18 anymore and was in town for a wedding, so I was looking for an affordable place to stay that was not crawling with roaches. After reading all the horrible reviews on the first place we had booked, we decided to change our reservations to the Montreal Espace Confort. I am sooo happy that we did. The rooms are impeccably clean and decorated in a tasteful modern style. They are not huge, but there are so many places to put your travel stuff that we never felt cramped. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful and accomodating. The location is perfect- in the heart of where you want to be with tons of restaurants and bars near by, and walking distance to everything else. The air conditioner was a godsend. This was an amazing value for the money. I am REALLY happy we stayed there and would reccommend it to anyone else! BTW, check out their website-- they have really good virtual tours of the hotel that accuratley describe the rooms. (sorry, I cant remember the webaddress off the top of my head.)
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay!

likes.liked: — clean and friendly and good location
likes.disliked: — room was a bit small, but that really wasnt a big deal. It wasnt tiny or anything.

reviews.text: I stayed here during the Formula 1 race in late June. Nice modern, clean hotel in an unbelievable location, especially for the race which was only 1 metro stop away. Tons & tons of dining/cafe/drinking/people-watching options on St. Denis, & a 10 minute walk to the metro. Great for vegetarians, as there is a Le Commensal vegetarian buffet restaurant almost next door. Maybe a 20 minute walk to the heart of downtown, Crescent street, Eaton Ctr, etc.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.text: Stayed here with 2 friends in June 07 for the Canadian Grand Prix weekend. A short walk to the Berri-UQAM metro, one stop to Jean-Drapeau, and you are on the race circuit!
reviews.title: Perfact location in Montreal

reviews.text: The property itself is located in the Latin Quarter, which is extremely laid back, with lots of good bars & restaurants and interesting shops. Don't miss the vast terrace at the rear of the nearby Saint-Sulpice bar!
reviews.title: Excellent little hotel

reviews.text: The area was not mobbed with F1 fans in the evenings either during race weekend which was nice, however if you wanted to hit the F1 parties, it is only a short metro or taxi journey to the main epicentres - Rue Crescent or Rue St-Denis.
reviews.title: Not a hotel or great value!

likes.liked: — Staff does its best to be helpful. Personal attention.
likes.disliked: — Tiny rooms. Not good value for price.

description: Located in the heart of the Montreal's Quartier Latin, surrounded by the UQAM and lower Saint-Denis Street, the area is known for its theatres, artistic atmosphere, cafés, multicultural bars and boutiques. It owes its name as reference to the Quartier Latin in Paris. The National Film Board of Canada's CinéRobotheque facility is based 2 streets away, next to the Cinémathèque québécoise. The Grande Bibliothèque du Québec joined these institutions in 2005. This area falls within the boundaries of the new Quartier des Spectacles entertainment district, now being developed. The revitalization of the Rue Ontario between Rue Saint-Denis and Boulevard Saint-Laurent has been boasted by Montréalers as the New Montréal (Nouveau Montréal). This area, surrounded by the Gay Village, the Plateau, and Quartier des Spectacles, has been a focal point for attracting young professionals, artists and emerging musicians.Auberge - Hotel Montreal Espace Confort provides guests with excellent customer service. Our friendly informality and flexibility, invites families, couples or singles feel equally at home. We meet everyone's needs from cozy bed and breakfasts to those located in the heart of the city life. Our simple but modern style and design, our quiet environment which can reach all of your needs, our convenient location for business travel and the proximity to downtown Montreal, will allow you to easily reach your destination for business, shopping and other pleasures.
